body_html:
@danmane I agree a strange contract for the analogy function. But IPython always prints an unreadable unicode output which is decoded or not.

IPython examples:

In [1]: '한글'
'\xed\x95\x9c\xea\xb8\x80'

In [2]: '한글'.decode('UTF-8')
u'\ud55c\uae00'

So I fixed the function to be printing a result like the nearby function which is also a function for an interactive mode.

body:
@danmane  I agree a strange contract for the analogy function. But IPython always prints an unreadable unicode output which is decoded or not.

IPython examples:

```
In [1]: '한글'
'\xed\x95\x9c\xea\xb8\x80'

In [2]: '한글'.decode('UTF-8')
u'\ud55c\uae00'
```

So I fixed the function to be printing a result like the nearby function which is also a function for an interactive mode.
